com.sun.tools.visualvm.tools.jmx

Class JmxModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sun.tools.visualvm.core.model.Model
      • com.sun.tools.visualvm.tools.jmx.JmxModel

  • public abstract class JmxModel
extends Model

    This class encapsulates the JMX functionality of the target Java application.

    Call JmxModelFactory.getJmxModelFor(Application) to get an instance of the JmxModel class.

    Usually this class will be used as follows:

     JmxModel jmx = JmxModelFactory.getJmxModelFor(application);
 if (jmx == null || jmx.getConnectionState() != JmxModel.ConnectionState.CONNECTED) {
     // JMX connection not available...
 } else {
     MBeanServerConnection mbsc = jmx.getMBeanServerConnection();
     if (mbsc != null) {
         // Invoke JMX operations...
     }
 }

    Any of the CachedMBeanServerConnectionFactory.getCachedMBeanServerConnection methods can be used to work with a CachedMBeanServerConnection instead of a plain MBeanServerConnection.

    In case the JMX connection is not established yet, you could register a listener on the JmxModel for ConnectionState property changes. The JmxModel notifies any PropertyChangeListeners about the ConnectionState property change to CONNECTED and DISCONNECTED. The JmxModel instance will be the source for any generated events.

    Polling for the ConnectionState is also possible by calling getConnectionState().

    Author:
    Luis-Miguel Alventosa, Tomas Hurka

    • Method Detail

      • addPropertyChangeListener

        public void addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Add a PropertyChangeListener to the listener list. The listener is registered for all properties. The same listener object may be added more than once, and will be called as many times as it is added. If listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        listener - the PropertyChangeListener to be added.

      • removePropertyChangeListener

        public void removePropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Removes a PropertyChangeListener from the listener list. This removes a PropertyChangeListener that was registered for all properties. If listener was added more than once to the same event source, it will be notified one less time after being removed. If listener is null, or was never added, no exception is thrown and no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        listener - the PropertyChangeListener to be removed.

      • getConnectionState

        public abstract JmxModel.ConnectionState getConnectionState()
        Returns the current connection state.
        Returns:
        the current connection state.

      • getMBeanServerConnection

        public abstract MBeanServerConnection getMBeanServerConnection()
        Returns the MBeanServerConnection for the connection to an application. The returned MBeanServerConnection object becomes invalid when the connection state is changed to the DISCONNECTED state.
        Returns:
        the MBeanServerConnection for the connection to an application. It returns null if the JMX connection couldn't be established.

      • getJMXServiceURL

        public abstract JMXServiceURL getJMXServiceURL()
        Returns the JMXServiceURL associated to this (@code JmxModel}.
        Returns:
        the JMXServiceURL associated to this (@code JmxModel}.

      • getSystemProperties

        public abstract Properties getSystemProperties()
        Returns the current system properties in the target Application.

        This method returns the system properties in the target virtual machine. Properties whose key or value is not a String are omitted. The method is approximately equivalent to the invocation of the method System.getProperties in the target virtual machine except that properties with a key or value that is not a String are not included.

        Returns:
        The system properties of target Application
        Since:
        VisualVM 1.3
        See Also:
        System.getProperties()

      • isTakeHeapDumpSupported

        public abstract boolean isTakeHeapDumpSupported()
        Tests if it is possible to obtain heap dump from target JVM via JMX.
        Returns:
        true if JMX supports heap dump, false otherwise
        Since:
        VisualVM 1.3

      • takeHeapDump

        public abstract boolean takeHeapDump(String fileName)
        Takes heap dump of target JVM via JMX. The heap is written to the fileName file in the same format as the hprof heap dump.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String where heap dump will be stored.
        Returns:
        returns true if operation was successful.
        Since:
        VisualVM 1.3

      • isTakeThreadDumpSupported

        public abstract boolean isTakeThreadDumpSupported()
        Tests if it is possible to obtain thread dump from target JVM via JMX.
        Returns:
        true if JMX supports thread dump, false otherwise
        Since:
        VisualVM 1.3

      • takeThreadDump

        public abstract String takeThreadDump()
        Takes thread dump of target JVM via JMX.
        Returns:
        Returns String of the thread dump from target JVM.
        Since:
        VisualVM 1.3

      • takeThreadDump

        public abstract String takeThreadDump(long[] threadIds)
        Returns the combined stack trace from each thread whose ID is in the input array threadIds,
        Parameters:
        threadIds - an array of thread IDs
        Returns:
        Returns String representing combined stack traces from all threads IDs
        Since:
        VisualVM 1.3

        Takes heap histogram of target Application.

        Since:

      • getFlagValue

        public abstract String getFlagValue(String name)
        print VM option. Note that VM option is the one which starts with -XX:
        Parameters:
        name - name of VM option. For example HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError
        Returns:
        Text value of VM option. For example true
        Since:
        VisualVM 1.3

        Parameters:

        value - New value of the VM option to be set
